com.github.macgregor.alexandria.remotes

Class JiveRemote

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.macgregor.alexandria.remotes.RestRemote
      • com.github.macgregor.alexandria.remotes.JiveRemote
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Remote

    public class JiveRemote
extends RestRemote
implements Remote
    Implements the Jive rest api for create/update/delete of documents. Does not currently support OAuth as I do not have access to a Jive instance that supports it. 
     
 ---
 remote:
   baseUrl: "https://jive.com/api/core/v3"
   username: "username"
   password: "password"
   supportsNativeMarkdown: false
   datetimeFormat: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ"
   requestTimeout: 60
   class: "com.github.macgregor.alexandria.remotes.JiveRemote"
 metadata:
 - sourcePath: "docs/images.md"
   title: "images.md"
   remoteUri: "https://jive.com/docs/DOC-1140818"
   sourceChecksum: 1751689934
   convertedChecksum: 2834756773
   createdOn: "2018-08-22T02:27:48.644+0000"
   lastUpdated: "2018-08-22T02:27:51.789+0000"
   extraProps:
     jiveParentUri: "https://jive.com/groups/alexandria-test-group"
     jiveParentPlaceId: "1448512"
     jiveParentApiUri: "https://jive.com/api/core/v3/places/1448512"
     jiveContentId: "1448517"
    Config.DocumentMetadata.extraProps:
    • USER DEFINED "jiveParentUri" - the uri used to access a parent place for the document. Setting this is how you link a Jive document with the place where it will live. This will not be used for the api calls as the api needs a different URI (of course). This is the link a human can easily find in their browser, we have to search for the place to get the details needed by the content api. See findParentPlace(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)
    • "jiveContentId" - the identifier Jive uses for a document, hard for the user to get themselves. We either set it when we create the document or look it up from Config.DocumentMetadata.remoteUri. See findDocument(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)
    • "jiveParentPlaceId" - the identifier Jive uses for a place. Set when we lookup the parent place from the user defined "jiveParentUri". See findParentPlace(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)
    • "jiveParentApiUri" - this is the actual api uri for a parent place. Set when we lookup the parent place from the user defined "jiveParentUri". See findParentPlace(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)
    See Also:
    Introduction to the Jive REST API

        • Config.RemoteConfig.password
        Specified by:

      • create

        public void create(Context context,
                   Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
            throws IOException
        Called to create a new document on the remote.

        If the remote doesnt support native markdown, the metadata should contain link to converted html file in Context.convertedPaths by the time this method is called. The implementation is responsible for updating the metadata with:

        • Config.DocumentMetadata.remoteUri
        • Config.DocumentMetadata.createdOn
        • Config.DocumentMetadata.lastUpdated
        • any remote specific metadata in Config.DocumentMetadata.extraProps
        We will always make a request to POST baseUrl/contents, but we may also need to make a request to GET baseUrl/places if the document has a parent place.
        Specified by:
        create in interface Remote
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - document to create
        Throws:
        IOException - Errors with local files or any requests made to the remote.
        See Also:
        Jive REST API - Create Content, needsParentPlaceUri(Config.DocumentMetadata), findParentPlace(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)

      • update

        public void update(Context context,
                   Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
            throws IOException
        Called to update an existing document on the remote.

        If the remote doesnt support native markdown, the metadata should contain link to converted html file in Context.convertedPaths by the time this method is called. The implementation is responsible for updating the metadata with:

        • Config.DocumentMetadata.lastUpdated
        • any remote specific metadata in Config.DocumentMetadata.extraProps
        We will always make a request to POST baseUrl/contents/$&#123;{@value #JIVE_CONTENT_ID}&#125;, but we may also need to make a request to GET baseUrl/contents to convert the browsers reachable document endpoint to the rest api endpoint for the document.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Remote
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - document to update
        Throws:
        IOException - Errors with local files or any requests made to the remote.
        See Also:
        Jive REST API - Update Content, needsContentId(Config.DocumentMetadata), findDocument(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)

      • delete

        public void delete(Context context,
                   Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
            throws IOException
        Called to delete an existing document on the remote.

        The implementation is responsible for updating the metadata with:

        • Config.DocumentMetadata.deletedOn
        • any remote specific metadata in Config.DocumentMetadata.extraProps
        Potentially three requests can be made here, because the Jive api handles requests for deleted documents poorly. Firstly, the usual GET baseUrl/contents if the metadata is missing the "jiveContentId". After that attempts to delete a document that is already deleted will yield a 403 unauthorized. So if for some reason Alexandria's state gets messed up and it tries to re-delete a document it will get an unexpected error. We avoid that by fetching the document directly via GET baseUrl/contents/$&#123;{@value #JIVE_CONTENT_ID}&#125;, checking for 403's and only executing DELETE baseUrl/contents/$&#123;{@value #JIVE_CONTENT_ID}&#125; if the document exists. Then we know a 403 is actually an authorization error.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface Remote
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - document to delete
        Throws:
        IOException - Errors with local files or any requests made to the remote.
        See Also:
        Jive REST API - Get Content, Jive REST API - Delete Content, needsContentId(Config.DocumentMetadata), findDocument(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)

      • needsContentId

        protected static boolean needsContentId(Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
        Determine if the indexed document needs to fetch the "jiveContentId" from the remote.
        Parameters:
        metadata - document to check
        Returns:
        true if "jiveContentId" needs to be retrieved from remote, false if its already set.

      • findDocument

        public void findDocument(Context context,
                         Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
                  throws IOException
        The uri a human uses to access a document (Config.DocumentMetadata.remoteUri) is not the uri we need to make rest requests. There is an sort of identifier in this uri, but we have to extract it and then run a search for it to get the "jiveContentId" which we can use to modify the document.
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - metadata to find on remote
        Throws:
        IOException - there was a problem with the request
        See Also:
        Jive REST API - Get Contents, Finding the Content ID and Place ID using Jive v3 API

      • needsParentPlaceUri

        public static boolean needsParentPlaceUri(Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
        Determine if an indexed document has a parent ("jiveParentUri" but needs to have the parent place id looked up.
        Parameters:
        metadata - document to check for parent information
        Returns:
        true if document has a parent but no "jiveParentApiUri", false if no parent or "jiveParentApiUri" already set

      • findParentPlace

        public void findParentPlace(Context context,
                            Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
                     throws IOException
        Just like with documents, the parent uri a human interacts with is not the same as the one we need for rest requests. This gives us the "jiveParentApiUri" to use in the post body of create and update requests.
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - document that needs parent details
        Throws:
        IOException - there was a problem with the request
        See Also:
        Jive REST API - Get Places, Finding the Content ID and Place ID using Jive v3 API
